sections.content: The Problem: Limited Patient Lifetime Value

Hedfirst was migraine-only, limiting patient lifetime value to $499/year with no expansion revenue. We needed a way to increase engagement and create additional value for patients beyond single-condition treatment.
Product Lifecycle
Phase 1: Strategic Hypothesis (Ideation)

Hypothesis: Migraine patients would value comprehensive health monitoring, especially if lab results revealed underlying conditions (vitamin deficiencies, hormone imbalances) contributing to migraines.

sections.title: Value Clarification
sections.content: This wasn't just feature expansion‚Äîit positioned Hedfirst as comprehensive health partner vs. single-condition treatment, increasing LTV and patient engagement while improving clinical outcomes.
Phase 2: Vendor Evaluation & Requirements (Validation)
Evaluated multiple at-home lab testing providers based on:

content: API quality and documentation
HIPAA compliance and BAA availability
Test panel options relevant to migraine care
Pricing structure for wholesale partnerships
Technical integration complexity

sections.content: Selected Choose Health despite higher cost due to superior API documentation and webhook system‚Äîestimated this decision would save 2+ weeks of integration time.
Phase 3: API Design & Prototyping (Implementation)
Analyzed 7-endpoint Choose Health API plus webhook system:

content: Order Creation: POST endpoint for creating lab kit orders
Order Status: GET endpoint for tracking fulfillment
Test Catalog: Available lab panels and pricing
Results Webhook: Real-time results delivery when labs complete
PDF Generation: Formatted results for provider review
Patient Portal: Iframe integration for requisition forms
Billing Integration: Webhook for payment confirmation

sections.content: Designed patient-facing lab ordering flow and provider dashboard for results review with interactive React prototypes.
Phase 4: Development & Delivery
Holistic implementation: Wrote 13 implementation tickets across frontend, backend, admin interfaces, and HIPAA-compliant data storage with 7-year retention.

content: Patient portal: Lab ordering, requisition forms, results viewing
Provider dashboard: Results review, clinical notes, lab history
Admin interface: Order management, fulfillment tracking
Backend: 7 API endpoints, webhook handlers, data models
Compliance: HIPAA-compliant storage, audit logging, 7-year retention
Billing: Integration with PayTheory for lab kit charges

sections.content: Phase 5: Beta Testing & Iteration
Launched to beta patients with close monitoring:

content: 25 beta patients offered lab testing in month 1
Gathered feedback on ordering flow and results presentation
Refined provider dashboard based on doctor usage patterns
Adjusted lab panel recommendations based on clinical findings

sections.content: Phase 6: Scale & Clinical Integration
Full rollout with clinical workflow integration:

content: Lab recommendations built into consultation flow
15-minute provider review sessions included with lab purchases
Follow-up protocols for abnormal results
Treatment adjustments based on lab insights

sections.content: Results & Impact

content: üìä Adoption Rate: 40% of beta patients ordered lab tests within first month
üî¨ Clinical Insights: 60% of patients showed vitamin deficiencies contributing to migraines
üí∞ Revenue Stream: New revenue at $99-$145 per lab panel
üéØ LTV Increase: Expanded patient value beyond $499/year membership
üè• Clinical Outcomes: Improved treatment targeting based on objective lab data
üîÑ Engagement: Lab results created ongoing touchpoints beyond medication management

sections.content: Key Lessons

Strategic integrations should solve business problems, not just add features. By positioning Hedfirst as a comprehensive health partner through lab testing, we increased LTV, improved clinical outcomes, and created new revenue streams. Choosing the right vendor (Choose Health) based on API quality saved weeks of integration time despite higher cost.
